lines.text: [to a wounded outlaw]
You call the tune and you pay the piper. Meaning... you don't like the treatment, don't rob the banks.
My apologies, ma'am. Slight negligence in his upbringing.
Mister, I ain't got a bigoted bone in my body. You don't drop that axe I'll blast you to hell as quick as I would a white man.
Give me my five dollars. If you get shot tonight, I'll disappear. Oh, I'll come back and bury you... and mumble something Christian over your grave.
Lightfoot, your kindness overwhelms me.
You're bleeding again, Pa.
Yeah, I guess it goes with the badge. You got a kerchief?
Yeah.
Jam it in this hole. It'll stop the bleeding.
[talking to the town drunk who is locked in a jail cell]
Charlie, what are you doing in here? It ain't Thursday.
A man has got a right to change his mind. Besides, it's going to rain on Thursday. And drinking in the rain, that's bad for your health.
[yelling at vultures circling overhead]
Oh no you ain't! You ain't going to get me today, you dirty beady-eyed little sons. Because old Pee Wee ain't going to die today. You filthy scavengers!
Oh, shut up, Simser! If a buzzard bites you, he'd never eat meat again.
[to an outlaw trying to rescue the prisoners]

Well, there's no use prodding around. I'm willing to die trying to keep 'em. The question is, are you willing to die trying to take 'em. Now I'm cold and hungry and wet and tired and short-tempered, so get on with it!
Oh, MacDonald! This is Cahill. How are you?
Fine... leastwise, no one has tried to hang me lately.
lines.character: MacDonald, Hermit who sells Cahill the mule

lines.text: One thing I hate more than a Comanche is half of one.
His name is Lightfoot. And I wouldn't call him, 'Breed' to his face if I was you... not if you want to reach maturity.
Any of you want to surrender?
Now what did you say?
I said, 'Any of you want to surrender?'
Five of us and one of you! I'll say one thing for you, J.D., you got style! Yes sir, you got style!
Lightfoot, Amy and me tried for a lot of years to have children... but maybe they came along too late in my life.
J.D.?
Yeah?
There ain't nothing too late... if you love it.
Do I have to shoot you or what?
